channel.title: My FAQ
channel.description:
I have a large amount of questions sorry if I sound annoying to you.
1) How do I turn on my private server? I keep uploading it but it says it's offline.
2) Is there a free website/forum maker online that I can use that has free domains?
3) How do I host my server to my website to make it playable on the website like Frugooscape did?
4) Can I use the official runescape music soundtrack in my private server?
5) How do I spawn monsters?
6) Which client lets you allow people to make houses in construction?
Sorry if I sound a little annoying to you. :D

item.title: My FAQ
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

  1. It’s not really the client as much as it is the server source; for the Construction skill, I recommend a well coded Hyperion base.

Read full topic

item.title: My FAQ
item.dc:creator: @YuudaiScape YuudaiScape
item.description:
@YuudaiScape wrote:

Slickscape99:

You got MSN?

I just created one YuudaiTatsuya@ymail.com

Read full topic

item.title: My FAQ
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Don’t use SMFNEW, setup your own forums using SMF on a host.

Read full topic

item.title: My FAQ
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“YuudaiScape, post:1, topic:370742”]I have a large amount of questions sorry if I sound annoying to you.

  1. How do I turn on my private server? I keep uploading it but it says it’s offline.

  2. Is there a free website/forum maker online that I can use that has free domains?

  3. How do I host my server to my website to make it playable on the website like Frugooscape did?

  4. Can I use the official runescape music soundtrack in my private server?

  5. How do I spawn monsters?

  6. Which client lets you allow people to make houses in construction?

Sorry if I sound a little annoying to you. :D[/quote]

1: Be sure to have the IP set correctly and the same for both client and actual server.

2: SMF as stated above, same as what MoparScape Forums are on.

3: I can’t help with this, but there are various webclient tutorials around the place. I’ll find one in a minute:

4: Yes, some clients have one or two songs, or .mp3s. Again, I can’t help but I’m sure there is a tutorial somewhere. Use the search bar. It’s your friend.

5: Go into your autospawn.cfg and follow the format already there. It usally goes NPCID, SPAWN X, SPAWN Y, RANGE X, RANGE Y, RANGE2 X, RANGE2 Y (these are the walking boundaries), WALKTYPE (usally 2 is best suited here) and then finally DESCRIPTION for reference purposes.

6: Not sure again, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: My FAQ
item.dc:creator: @Slickscape99 Slickscape99
item.description:
@Slickscape99 wrote:

You got MSN?

item.title: My FAQ
item.dc:creator: @YuudaiScape YuudaiScape
item.description:
@YuudaiScape wrote:

[quote=“Slickscape99, post:2, topic:370742”]1. Portforward and Run Source then Client.
2. Use SMFNEW
3. You need a webclient. Use ric’s tutorial.
4. Yes.
5. Use ::npc (ID)
6. Depends on Base.[/quote]

Thanks for helping you seem pretty cool sorry as well if I don’t talk much I’m pretty quiet. but I’m known as the forum freak sometimes when i’m in a good mood XD

Read full topic

item.title: My FAQ
item.dc:creator: @Slickscape99 Slickscape99
item.description:
@Slickscape99 wrote:

  1. Portforward and Run Source then Client.
  2. Use SMFNEW
  3. You need a webclient. Use ric’s tutorial.
  4. Yes.
  5. Use ::npc (ID)
  6. Depends on Base.

Read full topic
